guide.title: Configuration
guide.description: Learn how to configure Sync Gateway by using the configuration file or command-line options.

introduction.paragraph: This guide describes how to configure Sync Gateway. Configuration determines the runtime behavior of Sync Gateway, for example, its server configuration and the database or set of databases with which a Sync Gateway instance can interact. All configuration properties have default values.
Sync Gateway obtains its configuration when it starts. When you start Sync Gateway, you can do either of the following:

unordered-list.list-item: Specify a configuration file: A configuration file is a JSON file that defines configuration properties for Sync Gateway. To specify configuration parameters that are not available as command-line options or for Sync Gateway to serve multiple databases, you must use a configuration file.

Specify command-line options: You can specify a subset of configuration properties as command-line options. For command-line options that you do not specify, including for configuration properties that cannot be specified as command-line options, default values are used.

introduction.note: Using a configuration file is the recommended approach.
